document_data.name: Settlestone
document_data.allegiances: [[Reghedmen|Barbarians of Icewind Dale]], [[Companions of the Hall]], [[Mithral Hall]]
document_data.mainbody: '''Settlestone''', also known as '''Dwarvendarrow''' and '''The Ruin''' It was first inhabited by dwarves, fell into ruins, then was resettled in [[1358 DR]] by the [[Reghedmen|barbarians of Icewind Dale]] under the leadership of [[Berkthgar]] in alliance with Mithral Hall.

Geography.Structure: The dwarven village was built above ground which was a rare and unheard of creation for dwarven crafters at the time of Mithral Hall. Built to last, the buildings of Settlestone had large stone slabs of stone stacked together like a huge house of cards. The rebuilt settlement consisted of both stone buildings and [[tent]]s. The center of the village (although geographically located at the top of the uphill slant) was [[Hengorot (Settlestone)|Hengorot]], the mead hall inside a deerskin tent large enough to sit 400 barbarians at its huge tables.

document_data.Trade: In Settlestone, the barbarians lived a very prosperous life since they handled the trading of [[Dwarf|dwarven]] goods to merchants, its massive stone buildings still provided shelter to travelers, explorers, and monsters.
document_data.Defenses: In [[1372 DR]], the defenders of Settlestone consisted of about two hundred dwarven [[warrior]]s. They were charged with keeping the surrounding area free of hostile creatures and protected the main road against enemies. The road was also protected by booby traps, such as entire sections rigged to bury opponents under deadly avalanches, or simply fall away into deep ravines and be washed away under the onslaught of strong mountain streams. All of these defenses had to be triggered by the defending forces.
document_data.History: Hundreds of years before being inhabited by the barbarians of Icewind Dale, Settlestone was called ''Dwarvendarrow''. It was built by [[Bunko Battlehammer]], an ancestor of [[Bruenor Battlehammer]], and his clan. Dwarvendarrow served as a trade post outside Mithral Hall and it was the only place merchants could trade with the inhabitants of the dwarven city. [[Clan Battlehammer]] did not want strangers to visit their secret caves and mines.  Before being discovered in [[1356 DR]] by the [[Companions of the Hall]], Settlestone was also known as ''the Ruin''.
